label: Fine Structure Constant Geometric
mathematical_goal: Derive the fine structure constant alpha = 1/137.036 from G2 manifold geometry
theoretical_significance: The fine structure constant alpha ~ 1/137 governs electromagnetic interactions. In PM, it emerges from the geometric formula: 1/alpha = (c_kaf * b3^2) / (k_gimel * pi * S3_vol). This involves only topological invariants: b3 = 24, k_gimel = 12.318, and c_kaf = 27.2. The agreement to 0.05 sigma with the measured value validates the geometric origin of electromagnetism.

geometry.mechanism: U(1) gauge coupling from G2 holonomy
